intro: Strigosella circinata, commonly known as the curled leaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves that are often curled or twisted, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland areas or along stream banks. Strigosella circinata produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the Cyperaceae family.
